intro: Boechera patens, commonly known as the rockcress, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This species is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and small, white or yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring. Boechera patens typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or arctic regions. It is a perennial plant that is well adapted to cold climates and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
